blockchains.name: Cosmos Hub
blockchains.description: Cosmos is a decentralized network of independent parallel blockchains. ATOM, the native cryptocurrency of the Cosmos network, is essential for achieving the project's goal of creating an 'Internet of Blockchains.' Launched in 2019, Cosmos aims to solve the scalability, usability, and interoperability issues prevalent in existing blockchain ecosystems. The Cosmos Hub, the central blockchain of the network, uses ATOM for transaction fees, staking, and governance. By staking ATOM, users can earn rewards and participate in governance, influencing decisions on network upgrades and changes.

technical_contributions.contribution: Development and improvement of the Tendermint consensus engine, which underpins the Cosmos network and many other blockchain projects.
Implementation of the Cosmos SDK, a modular framework for building interoperable blockchain applications.
Development a new modules for the Cosmos SDK: creating a modules for specific business logic, integration with external APIs or implementation of unique consensus algorithms.

Development tools for automated smart contract testing: development and maintain tools for automating the testing of smart contracts written in CosmWasm or other languages used in the Cosmos ecosystem.

Documentation development and improvement: creating detailed guides and tutorials for using the Cosmos SDK, Tendermint, or IBC to make life easier for new developers, validators and increase the ecosystem's accessibility.
Development of monitoring tools for blockchains in the Cosmos ecosystem: build specialized dashboards or systems for real-time tracking of chain status, nodes, and transactions.

Contributing to CosmWasm: participation in the development of CosmWasm, a platform for running smart contracts in the Cosmos ecosystem, including performance improvements, adding new features, or optimizing security.

Creation and support of libraries for integration with the Cosmos SDK in different programming languages: writing and improvment SDKs for popular programming languages like Python, Java, and Go to make it easier for developers to integrate their applications with Cosmos blockchains.
Creating systems of tokenization objects in real life.
Install and maintain rpc and api nodes to ensure smooth network operations and delivery of accurate, up-to-date information.
Create and improve signaling bots that collect and integrate information from the network about lost blocks.
Create and improve signaling bots that collect and send users information about unbonding.
Testing of signaling tools, explorers, dashboards for bugs and inaccuracies.

Developing and sharing open-source tools: building and share open-source tools and scripts that help the community interact with the Cosmos network, such as monitoring, signaling tools, information websites or wallet integrations.
Making docker images and ansible scripts for easy installation nodes.

Contributing to the improvement of documentation for setting up and maintaining validator nodes, providing detailed guides, tutorials, and best practices to assist new validators in joining the network.

Actively engaging in the network governance process by submitting and reviewing proposals that impact the network, such as protocol upgrades, parameter changes, or community initiatives, helping to shape the future of the blockchain.
Operating a securing and reliable validator node, contributing to the network stability and security. Focus on maintaining high uptime and implementing strong security measures.

community_contributions.contribution: Organizing events and hackathons to promote blockchain education and development within the community.
Providing extensive documentation and support for developers building on the Cosmos network.
Organizing local meetups and workshops: hosting in-person or virtual events to bring together developers, validators, enthusiasts, and newcomers to discuss and learn about the Cosmos ecosystem.

Creating educational content: writing blog posts, tutorials, or create video content that explains various and/or dificults aspects of Cosmos, such as how to set up a node, how to use the Cosmos SDK, or how to deploy a smart contract on CosmWasm.

Moderating online forums, groups, chats, communities: helping manage and moderate discussions in Cosmos-related forums, Reddit, Discord channels, or Telegram groups to keep the community engaged and informed.

Translating documentation and resources: translating official documentation, guides, and community content into different languages to make Cosmos more accessible to a global audience. For example, you can take Cosmos news from twitter accounts and translate it on local languages such as Spanish, German, Russian, Chines, etc. You can translate by yourself or you can use LLM's for automatisation this process.

Providing feedback on new features and projects: actively participating in testnets, beta releases, or new projects within the Cosmos ecosystem, providing constructive feedback to developers and teams.
Mentoring newcomers to the ecosystem: guidance and support to new developers, validators, users entering the Cosmos ecosystem, helping them navigate the technology and community resources.
Improve the design of informational and ecosystem websites, help create adaptive website pages and pages for people with special needs.
Actively participate in the governance of the network by voting on proposals, discussing important issues, and encouraging others to get involved in the decision-making process.
Collaborate with the core team or other community members to design and execute marketing campaigns, outreach programs, or partnerships that promote the network.

blockchains.name: Osmosis
blockchains.description: Osmosis (OSMO) is the premier DEX and cross-chain DeFi hub within the Cosmos ecosystem, a network of over 50 sovereign, interoperable blockchains seamlessly connected through the Inter-Blockchain Communication Protocol (IBC). Pioneering in its approach, Osmosis offers a dynamic trading and liquidity provision experience, integrating non-IBC assets from other ecosystems, including Ethereum, Solana, Avalanche, and Polkadot. Initially adopting Balancer-style pools, Osmosis now also features a concentrated liquidity model that is orders of magnitude more capital efficient, meaning that significantly less liquidity is required to handle the same amount of trading volume with minimal slippage.

technical_contributions.contribution: Enhance the Osmosis front-end UI/UX: contributing to the improvement of the Osmosis web interface by optimizing user experience, streamlining the design, or adding new features like advanced analytics or trading tools.

Create advanced trading bots and tools, developing open-source trading bots, arbitrage bots, market making bots, strategy optimization frameworks that interact with Osmosis pools, helping users maximize their earnings.

Contribution to Osmosis smart contract development, writing and optimizing smart contracts that enhance the functionality of the Osmosis platform, such as contracts for governance, staking, or new financial products.

Improving Osmosis analytics and data visualization, developing tools or dashboards that provide real-time insights into the Osmosis network, including liquidity trends, trading volumes, and pool performance metrics.

Enhancing security auditing and testing, contributing to the security of the Osmosis platform by conducting audits of smart contracts, writing automated tests, or developing tools for vulnerability scanning and mitigation.

Contribute to Osmosis governance mechanisms, build and improve the technical infrastructure for Osmosis governance, such as voting interfaces, decentralized autonomous organization (DAO) tools, or proposal management systems.
Making dashboards and explorers to get actual real-time prices informations from Osmosis.
Making docker images and ansible scripts for easy installation nodes.
Operating a securing and reliable validator node, contributing to the network stability and security. Focus on maintaining high uptime and implementing strong security measures.

blockchains.name: Dymension
blockchains.description: Dymension is a Layer-1 blockchain network within the Cosmos ecosystem, designed to support modular blockchains called RollApps. These RollApps are application-specific blockchains that rely on Dymension for security and interoperability, enabling rapid deployment and customization of blockchain applications. Dymension also leverages the Inter-Blockchain Communication (IBC) protocol, allowing RollApps to seamlessly communicate and transfer assets with other blockchains in the Cosmos ecosystem, enhancing cross-chain functionality and scalability.

blockchains.name: Celestia
blockchains.description: Celestia is the first modular blockchain network that decouples consensus from execution, allowing developers to build scalable and customizable blockchains. It functions as a data availability layer, enabling other blockchains to securely publish their transactions and maintain high throughput. This modular approach enhances scalability and flexibility, making it easier to deploy and manage specialized blockchain applications.

blockchains.name: Secret Network
blockchains.description: Secret Network is a privacy-focused blockchain that enables privacy-preserving smart contracts, allowing developers to build decentralized applications (dApps) that can handle encrypted data. It uses trusted execution environments (TEEs) to ensure that inputs, outputs, and states of smart contracts remain confidential, even from the nodes processing them. This approach makes Secret Network unique in providing strong privacy guarantees while maintaining decentralization.

blockchains.name: Bitcanna

blockchains.name: Evmos
blockchains.description: Evmos is a scalable and interoperable blockchain that bridges the Ethereum and Cosmos ecosystems, enabling Ethereum-based applications to run within the Cosmos network. It leverages the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) and the Cosmos SDK, allowing developers to deploy smart contracts and dApps with cross-chain functionality. Evmos aims to combine the security and tools of Ethereum with the scalability and interoperability of Cosmos, making it a powerful platform for decentralized applications.

blockchains.name: Agoric

It leverages the Cosmos SDK for scalability and features a unique secure execution environment that isolates smart contracts to prevent common vulnerabilities. Agoric focuses on creating a robust DeFi ecosystem with tools and frameworks that allow developers to easily create and deploy decentralized financial applications.

The network provides developers with simple APIs and SDKs to integrate cross-chain capabilities into their applications, making it easier to build interoperable decentralized solutions.

blockchains.name: Noble
blockchains.description: Noble is a Cosmos application-specific blockchain designed for native asset issuance, with a focus on enhancing efficiency and interoperability within the Cosmos ecosystem. The platform is particularly known for its role in issuing USDC, making it a critical hub for digital asset issuance and transfers via the Inter-Blockchain Communication (IBC) protocol. Noble aims to provide a secure and scalable environment for managing digital assets, positioning itself as a key infrastructure for seamless cross-chain operations.

blockchains.name: Gravity-Bridge
blockchains.description: Gravity Bridge is a decentralized blockchain built on the Cosmos SDK, designed to facilitate interoperability between the Cosmos ecosystem and Ethereum, as well as other Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) chains. It acts as a neutral bridge, allowing assets to be transferred securely and efficiently between these networks, using Inter-Blockchain Communication (IBC) for Cosmos-based tokens and Gravity Bridge's Ethereum contracts for ERC20 tokens. This enables users to move assets like ATOM or USDC between Cosmos and Ethereum, unlocking liquidity and expanding the utility of these assets across both ecosystems.

technical_contributions.contribution: Build decentralized applications (dApps) that leverage Gravity Bridge interoperability, allowing users to seamlessly interact with assets across Cosmos and Ethereum. This could include DeFi platforms that utilize liquidity from both ecosystems.

Kavaâ€™s unique co-chain architecture allows for a versatile and highly interoperable environment, supporting DeFi protocols and decentralized applications across multiple blockchain ecosystems. It provides users with a range of financial services, including lending, staking, and yield farming, through its rapidly growing DeFi ecosystem.

technical_contributions.contribution: Developing a unique co-chain architecture that integrates Cosmos SDK and Ethereum EVM for interoperability and scalability.
Implementing Kava Rise, a developer incentives program that has driven significant protocol growth on the network.
Launching the Kava EVM, which connects Ethereum dApps directly to the Cosmos ecosystem, enhancing cross-chain DeFi opportunities.

community_contributions.contribution: Engaging the community through governance, allowing KAVA holders to vote on network upgrades and protocol decisions.
Providing developer grants and financial incentives through the Kava Rise program to support the growth of the Kava ecosystem.
Supporting cross-chain asset integration, enabling assets from various blockchains to be used in Kavas DeFi protocols.

Translating documentation and resources: translating official documentation, guides, and community content into different languages to make network more accessible to a global audience. For example, you can take Network news from twitter accounts and translate it on local languages such as Spanish, German, Russian, Chines, etc. You can translate by yourself or you can use LLM's for automatisation this process.

blockchains.name: Band Protocol
blockchains.description: Band Protocol is a decentralized data oracle platform that connects smart contracts with real-world data and external APIs. Built on the Cosmos SDK, Band Protocol aggregates and connects off-chain data to on-chain smart contracts in a secure and reliable manner. It aims to offer a scalable, cross-chain solution for data integration, ensuring that smart contracts have access to accurate and timely information from various data sources.

technical_contributions.contribution: Providing a decentralized oracle network that aggregates and verifies data from various sources, ensuring reliability and accuracy for smart contracts.
Implementing cross-chain data capabilities, allowing data to be accessed and utilized across different blockchain networks.
Developing the BandChain, which is optimized for high throughput and low latency in data querying and aggregation.

community_contributions.contribution: Facilitating community governance through BAND token holders who can vote on network upgrades and protocol decisions.
Offering grants and funding for projects that integrate Band Protocols oracles into their ecosystems.
Engaging in educational outreach and community building through events, AMAs, and active participation in the broader blockchain space.

blockchains.name: Chain4Energy
blockchains.description: Chain4Energy (C4E) is a Layer 1 blockchain designed specifically for the energy sector, providing a decentralized infrastructure for managing energy production, trading, and community engagement. C4E leverages Cosmos SDK and IBC to enable efficient and transparent energy data management, peer-to-peer energy trading, and the digitization of renewable energy certificates.

technical_contributions.contribution: Developing a decentralized platform for energy management and trading on the blockchain.
Creating tools for immutable energy data tracking and recording using blockchain technology.
Implementing a Layer 1 infrastructure capable of supporting smart contracts and dApps for the energy market.
Building secure and efficient mechanisms for energy data tokenization and validation on the blockchain.
Integrating green energy certificates into the blockchain for enhanced traceability and market access.
Optimizing the platform for scalability and high transaction throughput, supporting up to 10,000 TPS.
Operating a high-performance validator node on the blockchain, ensuring high availability and security. This helps maintain network stability and trustworthiness.
Creating or enhance tools that assist validators in monitoring their node performance, tracking staking operations, and detecting potential issues, ensuring the overall health of the network.
Contributing to the creation of comprehensive onboarding guides, best practices, and troubleshooting resources for new validators, making it easier for them to set up and maintain their nodes.
Making docker images and ansible scripts for easy installation nodes.

community_contributions.contribution: Hosting community-driven governance to propose and vote on changes to the network.
Providing educational resources and tutorials for new users and developers within the energy ecosystem.
Supporting the adoption of decentralized energy solutions through events and workshops.
Creating content to raise awareness about sustainable energy practices and blockchain technology.
Moderating forums and social media groups to ensure active engagement and support within the community.
Organizing hackathons and grant programs to incentivize innovation and development on the Chain4Energy platform.

Translating documentation and resources: translating official documentation, guides, and community content into different languages to make network more accessible to a global audience. For example, you can take Network news from twitter accounts and translate it on local languages such as Spanish, German, Russian, Chines, etc. You can translate by yourself or you can use LLM's for automatisation this process.

blockchains.name: dYdX
blockchains.description: dYdX is a Layer 1 blockchain network built on the Cosmos SDK, leveraging CometBFT for consensus. It aims to provide a fully decentralized, scalable trading platform, particularly focused on perpetual contracts. The network uses the DYDX token for staking, governance, and securing the blockchain, offering a decentralized infrastructure with an off-chain order book and matching engine.

technical_contributions.contribution: Development of a decentralized off-chain order book and matching engine for high scalability.
Implementation of CometBFT consensus for secure and efficient block validation.
Creation of open-source tools and software, including APIs and mobile apps, for decentralized trading.
Optimizing the blockchain infrastructure to handle thousands of transactions per second.
Designing staking and governance mechanisms that align validator incentives with network security.
Building secure bridges and protocols for seamless asset migration from Ethereum to dYdX Chain.
Operating a high-performance validator node on the blockchain, ensuring high availability and security. This helps maintain network stability and trustworthiness.
Creating or enhance tools that assist validators in monitoring their node performance, tracking staking operations, and detecting potential issues, ensuring the overall health of the network.
Contributing to the creation of comprehensive onboarding guides, best practices, and troubleshooting resources for new validators, making it easier for them to set up and maintain their nodes.
Making docker images and ansible scripts for easy installation nodes.

community_contributions.contribution: Hosting governance processes that empower the community to propose and vote on key protocol changes.
Providing extensive documentation, guides, and support to help users interact with the dYdX Chain.
Organizing educational events and community discussions to foster user engagement and protocol development.
Creating incentives for validators and stakers, promoting a diverse and secure network environment.
Supporting open-source development initiatives and grants for building tools on the dYdX Chain.
Engaging with users through social media platforms and forums to collect feedback and improve the protocol.

blockchains.name: Neutron
blockchains.description: Neutron is a smart contract platform built on the Cosmos SDK that brings advanced cross-chain functionality to the Cosmos ecosystem. It enables developers to create scalable and secure decentralized applications (dApps) using CosmWasm, with security provided by the Cosmos Hub through Interchain Security. Neutron supports smart contracts with interchain queries and transactions, allowing seamless cross-chain operations and data retrieval.

technical_contributions.contribution: Implementation of Interchain Queries (ICQs) and Interchain Accounts (ICAs) to enhance cross-chain data retrieval and transaction management.
Development of a secure and scalable smart contract platform using CosmWasm, optimized for cross-chain interactions.
Integration of advanced cross-chain functionalities, allowing smart contracts to interact with other blockchains within the Cosmos ecosystem.
Support for modular smart contract development with a focus on secure data handling and efficient execution across multiple blockchains.
Providing in-protocol automation and custom fee structures to facilitate the creation of efficient and cost-effective decentralized applications.
Developing infrastructure that includes operator sets, integrations with wallets, explorers, and other essential tools for developers.

community_contributions.contribution: Governance managed by the Neutron DAO, with a unique model that includes multiple subDAOs for more effective and decentralized decision-making.
Providing educational resources, tutorials, and community support to help developers build on Neutron using CosmWasm and interchain technologies.
Organizing events, hackathons, and community discussions to engage developers and promote the growth of Neutronâ€™s ecosystem.
Establishing a sustainable tokenomics model with $NTRN distribution to incentivize community participation and ecosystem development.
Maintaining a transparent and inclusive governance structure that allows community members to propose and vote on network changes.
Supporting a collaborative developer community focused on building innovative cross-chain applications within the Cosmos ecosystem.

blockchains.name: Saga
blockchains.description: Saga is a Layer 1 protocol designed to enable developers to easily deploy specialized application-specific blockchains known as Chainlets. By offering shared security and automated deployment pipelines, Saga allows for the creation of highly customizable and scalable chains that can run independently, providing a flexible and predictable development environment ideal for gaming, DeFi, and other Web3 applications.

technical_contributions.contribution: Developing Chainlets, which are application-specific blockchains that provide independent, scalable environments for deploying smart contracts.
Providing shared security through Saga validators, allowing developers to leverage Saga's security model without needing separate validator sets.
Supporting VM-agnostic environments, allowing the use of various virtual machines including EVM, SolanaVM, and MoveVM, enhancing flexibility for developers.
Enabling parallelized and independent Chainlets to avoid resource competition, optimizing performance and scalability.
Implementing validator orchestration tools to efficiently manage multiple Chainlets, automating the security and operation of the network.
Automating cross-chain interoperability and fast bridging between Chainlets and other ecosystems, enhancing composability.

community_contributions.contribution: Launching the Saga Innovator Program to support projects in gaming, DeFi, and entertainment, promoting collaboration and ecosystem growth.
Providing educational resources, technical support, and funding opportunities for developers building on Saga.
Facilitating community engagement through events, hackathons, and roundtables to foster innovation and knowledge sharing among developers.
Implementing a decentralized governance model that allows the community to propose and vote on protocol changes and resource allocations.
Building partnerships with other Layer 1 protocols like Polygon, Avalanche, and Celestia to expand Sagaâ€™s reach and integration capabilities.
Supporting airdrop campaigns to reward community members and early adopters from various ecosystems like Cosmos, Polygon, and Avalanche.

blockchains.name: AssetMantle
blockchains.description: AssetMantle is a decentralized infrastructure built using the Cosmos SDK that facilitates the creation, ownership, exchange, and transfer of digitally owned assets, including NFTs. It provides a multi-tenant NFT marketplace framework that allows creators and collectors to securely mint, own, and trade digital assets on its blockchain. AssetMantle supports a wide variety of assets, from digital collectibles to real-world assets, enabling interoperability, value creation, and identity management in the Web3 ecosystem.

technical_contributions.contribution: Built on the Cosmos SDK with the Tendermint core consensus engine to facilitate asset tokenization and NFT trading.
Provides a highly intuitive and easy-to-use NFT marketplace with features such as lazy minting, cross-chain interoperability, and TradeRoom for real-time trading.
Supports a wide range of asset classes, including web3 native assets, digital assets, real-world assets (RWAs), and hybrid assets, ensuring a high level of interoperability.
Developed a proprietary standard for digitally owned assets (iDOA) and digitally controlled identities (iDCI), enabling uniformity and interoperability across the platform.
Enables creators to build their customized marketplaces using MantleBuilder, offering complete no-code customization and branding.
Operating a high-performance validator node on the blockchain, ensuring high availability and security. This helps maintain network stability and trustworthiness.
Creating or enhance tools that assist validators in monitoring their node performance, tracking staking operations, and detecting potential issues, ensuring the overall health of the network.
Contributing to the creation of comprehensive onboarding guides, best practices, and troubleshooting resources for new validators, making it easier for them to set up and maintain their nodes.
Making docker images and ansible scripts for easy installation nodes.

community_contributions.contribution: Providing educational resources and documentation to onboard creators, collectors, and developers.
Establishing partnerships with various ecosystems and networks to expand AssetMantleâ€™s reach and value proposition.
Facilitating the creation of a decentralized identity stack, enabling self-sovereign identities and trust in the ecosystem.
Supporting an open and democratic approach to ecosystem growth and innovation through a community-driven roadmap and development.
Implementing airdrop campaigns and incentive programs such as the MantleDrop to reward community members and early adopters.

blockchains.name: Sentinel
blockchains.description: Sentinel is a decentralized, open-source network focused on enabling a secure and private bandwidth-sharing ecosystem through a peer-to-peer bandwidth marketplace. It offers a decentralized VPN (dVPN) service, providing enhanced privacy, anonymity, and censorship resistance for users. The Sentinel blockchain uses blockchain technology to facilitate a transparent and trustless environment, while leveraging Cosmos SDK and Tendermint Core for its consensus mechanism.

technical_contributions.contribution: Sentinel has developed a peer-to-peer bandwidth marketplace, allowing users to share or access private bandwidth through decentralized means.
Utilizes Cosmos SDK and Tendermint Core for its blockchain infrastructure, offering scalability and interoperability.
Offers a decentralized VPN (dVPN) service that enhances user privacy and anonymity, while resisting censorship.

community_contributions.contribution: Sentinel has created an open-source platform, inviting community developers to contribute to the dVPN ecosystem.
Integrates decentralized governance, enabling the community to participate in protocol updates and changes.
